articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Russian and Ukrainian officials are due to sit down on Monday in the Turkish city of Istanbul for their second round of direct peace talks since 2022, but the two sides are still far apart on how to end the war and the fighting is stepping up.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine to talk about peace but are still far apart

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran is poised to reject a U.S. proposal to end a decades-long nuclear dispute, an Iranian diplomat said, slamming it as a "non-starter" that fails to address Tehran's interests and leaves Washington's stance on uranium enrichment unchanged.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran poised to dismiss US nuclear proposal, says Iranian diplomat

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove, Rich McKay
articles.description: The suspect in an attack on a pro-Israeli rally in Colorado that injured eight people was being held on Monday on an array of charges, including assault and the use of explosives, in lieu of a $10 million bail, according to official records.
articles.title: Colorado attack suspect on expired visa charged with assault, use of explosives

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: The United States has given its blessing to a plan by Syria's new leadership to incorporate thousands of foreign jihadist former rebel fighters into the national army, provided that it does so transparently, President Donald Trump's envoy said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US gives nod to Syria to bring foreign jihadist ex-rebels into army

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: South Koreans will elect a new president on Tuesday to cap six months of turmoil triggered by a shock martial law briefly imposed by former leader Yoon Suk Yeol that marred the country's reputation as a vibrant, if at times chaotic, democracy.
articles.title: South Koreans vote for president after months of turmoil triggered by martial law

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The reported incident was the latest in a series underscoring the volatile security situation that has complicated aid delivery.
articles.title: Three people reported killed and dozens wounded at an aid site in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish nationalist opposition candidate Karol Nawrocki won the second round of the country's presidential election with 50.89% of the votes, the electoral commission said early on Monday on its website.
articles.title: Polish eurosceptic Nawrocki wins presidential vote, electoral commission says

articles.author: Karl Badohal, Karin Strohecker, Gergely Szakacs
articles.description: Poland's path to narrowing its fiscal deficit, maintaining its credit ratings and keeping investors on board looks more difficult following conservative nationalist Karol Nawrocki's presidential election triumph.
articles.title: Polish nationalist's election victory deepens fiscal uncertainty

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A man who set fire to a copy of the Koran outside the Turkish consulate in London was found guilty on Monday of committing a religiously aggravated public order offence, in a verdict critics said effectively reinstated an abolished blasphemy law.
articles.title: Man convicted for burning Koran outside London's Turkish consulate

articles.author: Ahmed Kingimi
articles.description: At least 20 people were killed in a military airstrike in Nigeria's northwestern Zamfara state over the weekend, residents and Amnesty International said on Monday, with the rights group calling for authorities to investigate the incident.
articles.title: Nigeria army airstrike kills 20 people, Amnesty and residents says
